description: From Middle English unhorsen, equivalent to un- +â€Ž horse.

verbs.description: unhorse (third-person singular simple present unhorses, present participle unhorsing, simple past and past participle unhorsed)

entries.meaning: To forcibly remove from a horse.
examples: The knight was unhorsed when his opponent's lance struck his shield.

entries.meaning: (by extension) To disrupt or unseat; to remove from a position.
examples: The incumbent governor was unhorsed by the scandal that broke during his reelection campaign.
